intro: Euryops hebecarpus, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow or orange daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Euryops hebecarpus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
